questions.question: The United Nations was founded on 26 June 1945 after the end of World War II. What is the primary role of the UN?

choices.answer: To maintain international peace and security
To create an International Space Station

questions.title: "WE THE PEOPLES OF THE UNITED NATIONS..."
questions.description: Delegates from 50 nations met in San Francisco in 1945 for two months and signed the UN Charter on 26 June. It created a commitment to maintain international peace and security, uphold human rights and develop friendly relations between countries.

imageMetadata.altText: The San Francisco Conference, 25 April-26 June 1945

questions.question: The UN is currently made up of 193 Member States. Which state is the newest member and joined in 2011?

imageMetadata.altText: General Assembly Approves Admission of South Sudan to the UN

questions.question: Where is the United Nations main headquarter?

questions.title: The United Nations is headquartered in New York
questions.description: With regional headquarters in Geneva (Switzerland), Vienna (Austria), and Nairobi (Kenya), the work of the Organization is, however, mostly done locally through 129 Resident Coordinator Offices (RCOs) that coordinate UN work in developing countries.

questions.question: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights was the first document to give protection of fundamental human rights.

imageMetadata.altText: Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt of the United States holding a Declaration of Human Rights poster

questions.question: How many times, in its 75 years, has the UN, its agencies and staff been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize?

imageMetadata.altText: Photographic reproduction of the Nobel Peace Medal

questions.question: Six official languages of the United Nations are Arabic, Chinese, English and...

imageMetadata.altText: United Nations interpreters provide simultaneous translation for a Security Council meeting (2008).

questions.question: Through the work of the UN, more than 1 billion people have moved out of extreme poverty since 1990.

imageMetadata.altText: A child practices his writing during a kindergarten class in Tachilek, Myanmar.

questions.title: Coorperation bettered international public health
questions.description: Since foundation of WHO, specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for international public health, the world successfully eradicated two diseases smallox and rinderpest, and is near to eradicate polio.

questions.question: The disease eradicated through cooperation between countries and with assistance from the WHO:

imageMetadata.altText: Doctors Administer WHO Vaccination to a Child

questions.question: How important – or not – is it for countries to work together to manage global issues that affect our future?

questions.title: Share your vision of a better future for all!
questions.description: What would you advise the UN Secretary-General to do to address the world's pressing issues? #HaveyourSay www.UN75.online
